AB Control Hub Description: AB Control Hub is an advanced, free web-based tool designed to diagnose, test, and calibrate Sony PlayStation controllers directly from your browser. Whether you are experiencing stick drift or just want to check your controller's input latency, this tool provides a comprehensive solution without downloading any software.
AB Control Hub is an advanced, free web-: AB Control Hub is an advanced, free web-based tool designed to diagnose, test, and calibrate Sony PlayStation controllers directly from your browser. Whether you are experiencing analog stick drift or just want to check your controller's input latency, this tool provides a comprehensive solution without downloading any software.
AB Control Hub is the ultimate Web-Based: AB Control Hub is the ultimate Web-Based tool to test and calibrate PlayStation controllers (DualSense & DualShock 4). Fix analog stick drift, measure input latency, and test buttons online without installing software.
AB Control Hub is the ultimate Web-Based tool to test and calibrate PlayStation controllers.
Drift Calibration Feature: Permanently fix stick drift on DualSense and DualShock 4.
Input Analysis Feature: Measure Polling Rate (Hz), Input Latency (ms), and Jitter.
Output Testing Feature: Test Vibration motors, Adaptive Triggers, and LED colors.
Device Info Feature: Read battery level, firmware version, and hardware details.
Permanently fix stick drift on DualSense: Permanently fix stick drift on DualSense and DualShock 4.

Test Vibration motors, Adaptive Triggers: Test Vibration motors, Adaptive Triggers, and LED colors.

This guide explains the technical detail: This guide explains the technical details of Analog Stick Drift and how AB Control Hub uses WebHID to fix it permanently on DualSense and DualShock 4 controllers.
Stick drift is a phenomenon where your g: Stick drift is a phenomenon where your game character moves or looks around without you touching the controller. This is caused by the wear and tear of the potentiometers inside the analog stick module.
<strong>Hardware Drift:</strong> Physica:
Hardware Drift: Physical damage or dust inside the sensor. While cleaning helps, the center point often shifts permanently.
Software Calibration: This is where AB Control Hub shines. Instead of replacing the stick, we reprogram the controller's internal memory (NVS) to recognize the "new" center point, effectively eliminating drift without soldering.
Traditional tools like DS4Windows requir: Traditional tools like DS4Windows require installing drivers and running background services. WebHID (Web Human Interface Device) is a modern browser API that allows this website to communicate directly with your controller via USB or Bluetooth.
<strong>Zero Latency:</strong> Commands: Zero Latency: Commands are sent directly to the hardware.
<strong>Privacy First:</strong> No data: Privacy First: No data is uploaded to any server. All processing happens locally in your browser.
<strong>OS Independent:</strong> Works o: OS Independent: Works on Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android (via Chrome).
Use a high-quality USB data cable. While: Use a high-quality USB data cable. While Bluetooth works for testing, we recommend USB for calibration to ensure connection stability during the writing process.
Click on <strong>\"1. Calibrate stick ce: Click on "1. Calibrate stick center". The tool will measure the current resting position of your sticks and calculate the offset needed to make them read (0,0) again. This fixes the drift.
Click on <strong>\"2. Calibrate stick ra: Click on "2. Calibrate stick range". You will be asked to rotate both sticks fully. This maps the outer edges of the analog movement, ensuring you can reach 100% speed in games in all directions (fixing "Slow Turn" issues).
<strong>Q: Is this permanent?</strong><b:
Q: Is this permanent?
A: Yes, the calibration is saved to the controller's internal memory. It works on consoles (PS4/PS5) and PC even after you close this site.
<strong>Q: My controller is not detected:
Q: My controller is not detected?
A: Ensure you are using Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge. Close other apps like Steam or DS4Windows as they might hijack the connection.

Push the stick straight up/down/left/rig: Push the stick straight up/down/left/right as far as possible.
<strong>Average circularity error:</stro: Average circularity error: smaller is not always better! Aim for 7-9 %.
Sony controllers come from the factory c: Sony controllers come from the factory calibrated to have an average circularity error of nearly 10 %, and this is now what games expect. Too perfect circularity can make movements and aim feel stiff and unresponsive in some games.

This involves temporarily disabling writ: This involves temporarily disabling write protection by applying +1.8V to a specific test point on each module.
You can do this in two ways:: You can do this in two ways:
<b>Internally</b>: by soldering a wire f: Internally: by soldering a wire from a +1.8V source to the write-protect TP.

Welcome to the F.A.Q. section! Below, yo: Welcome to the F.A.Q. section! Below, you'll find answers to some of the most commonly asked questions about this website. If you have any other inquiries or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to me directly. Your feedback and questions are always welcome!
Behind the scenes, this website is the c: Behind the scenes, this website is the culmination of one year of dedicated effort in reverse-engineering DualShock controllers for fun/hobby from a random guy on the internet.
, it was discovered that there exist som: , it was discovered that there exist some undocumented commands on DualShock controllers that can be sent via USB and are used during factory assembly process. If these commands are sent, the controller starts the recalibration of analog sticks.
While the primary focus of this research: While the primary focus of this research wasn't initially centered on recalibration, it became apparent that a service offering this capability could greatly benefit numerous individuals. And thus, here we are.
Does the calibration remain effective du: Does the calibration remain effective during gameplay on PS4/PS5?
Yes, if you tick the checkbox \"Write ch: Yes, if you tick the checkbox "Write changes permanently in the controller". In that case, the calibration is flashed directly in the controller firmware. This ensures that it remains in place regardless of the console it's connected to.
Is this an officially endorsed service?: Is this an officially endorsed service?
No, this service is simply a creation by: No, this service is simply a creation by a DualShock enthusiast.
Does this website detect if a controller: Does this website detect if a controller is a clone?
Yes, only DualShock4 at the moment. This: Yes, only DualShock4 at the moment. This happened because I accidentally purchased some clones, spent time identifying the differences and added this functionality to prevent future deception.
Unfortunately, the clones cannot be cali: Unfortunately, the clones cannot be calibrated anyway, because they only clone the behavior of a DualShock4 during normal gameplay, not all the undocumented functionalities.
If you want to extend this detection fun: If you want to extend this detection functionality to DualSense, please ship me a fake DualSense and you'll see it in few weeks.
I maintain two separate to-do lists for: I maintain two separate to-do lists for this project, although the priority has yet to be established.
The first list is about enhancing suppor: The first list is about enhancing support for DualShock4 and DualSense controllers:
Improve detection of clones, particularl: Improve detection of clones, particularly beneficial for those seeking to purchase used controllers with assurance of authenticity.
Enhance user interface (e.g. provide add: Enhance user interface (e.g. provide additional controller information)
Additionally, explore the possibility of: Additionally, explore the possibility of reviving non-functioning DualShock controllers (further discussion available on Discord for interested parties).
The second list contains new controllers: The second list contains new controllers I aim to support:
Each of these tasks presents both immens: Each of these tasks presents both immense interest and significant time investment. To provide context, supporting a new controller typically demands 6-12 months of full-time research, alongside a stroke of good fortune.
Can I reset a permanent calibration to p: Can I reset a permanent calibration to previous calibration?
Can you overwrite a permanent calibratio: Can you overwrite a permanent calibration?
Yes. Simply do another permanent calibra: Yes. Simply do another permanent calibration.
Stickdrift is caused by a physical defec: Stickdrift is caused by a physical defect; namely dirt, worn potentiometer or in some cases a worn spring.
This software will not fix stick drift o: This software will not fix stick drift on its own if you already experience that. What it will help with, is ensuring the new joystick(s) will function properly after replacing the old one(s) to work well with.
I have noticed some controllers out of t: I have noticed some controllers out of the box have worse factory calibration than if I would recalibrate them. Especially true for circularity of SCUF controllers with a unique shell.
(Dualsense) Will updating the firmware r: (Dualsense) Will updating the firmware reset calibration?

The Technical Guide to Controller Calibr: The Technical Guide to Controller Calibration
Deep dive into Analog Stick Drift, WebHI: Deep dive into Analog Stick Drift, WebHID Technology, and Hardware Diagnostics.
<i class=\"fas fa-microchip me-2\"></i>: 1. The Science Behind Stick Drift
Most modern controllers (DualSense, Dual: Most modern controllers (DualSense, DualShock 4, Xbox) use ALPS analog stick modules. These modules rely on two potentiometers—one for the X-axis (horizontal) and one for the Y-axis (vertical). A potentiometer is essentially a variable resistor that uses a physical wiper blade sliding across a carbon track to read position.
Every time you move the stick, friction: Every time you move the stick, friction occurs. Over hundreds of hours of gameplay (like Call of Duty or FIFA), this friction causes two things:
<strong>Wear of the Carbon Track:</stron: Wear of the Carbon Track: The resistive material wears down, changing the electrical resistance values.
<strong>Dust Accumulation:</strong> Cond: Dust Accumulation: Conductive dust from the wear process can settle on the tracks, causing "jitter" or erratic signals.
When this happens, the controller report: When this happens, the controller reports that the stick is moving (e.g., Value +15) even when it is physically centered (Value 0). This is Stick Drift.
Since we cannot physically repair the ca: Since we cannot physically repair the carbon track via software, our tool uses Firmware Level Calibration. We calculate the exact error offset of your drifted stick and write a new "Center Point" to the controller's permanent memory (NVS). This forces the controller to mathematically ignore the drift.
<i class=\"fas fa-network-wired me-2\"><: 2. How WebHID Changes the Game
Historically, calibrating a controller r: Historically, calibrating a controller required downloading executable files (.exe), installing drivers, and risking viruses. AB Control Hub is built on the WebHID API (Web Human Interface Device), a cutting-edge browser standard.
<strong>Direct Hardware Access:</strong>: Direct Hardware Access: The browser communicates directly with the USB/Bluetooth HID Report Descriptors. This allows for millisecond-level precision in reading input lags.
<strong>Sandboxed Security:</strong> Unl: Sandboxed Security: Unlike native apps, a website cannot read your files or access other hardware without explicit permission. This makes AB Control Hub significantly safer than downloading random tools.
<strong>Cross-Platform:</strong> The und: Cross-Platform: The underlying JavaScript code runs identically on Windows, macOS, Linux, and Android.
3. Detecting Counterfeit Controllers
The market is flooded with \"High Copy\": The market is flooded with "High Copy" controllers. While they look identical to the original Sony DualSense, their internals are vastly inferior. Use our tool to spot them:
Switch the joystick visualizer to <stron: Switch the joystick visualizer to "Circularity Mode". Rotate your stick in a perfect circle.
<strong>Original:</strong> Average error: Original: Average error is typically 8% - 12%. The movement is smooth.
<strong>Fake:</strong> Average error oft: Fake: Average error often exceeds 20%. The shape may look like a square (diamond) rather than a circle, indicating cheap non-linear potentiometers.
Original controllers via USB typically h: Original controllers via USB typically have a stable polling rate (e.g., 250Hz or 1000Hz depending on overclock). Fake controllers often have unstable polling rates, leading to input lag spikes visible in our graph.
Ensure your controller is sufficiently c: Ensure your controller is sufficiently charged and the cable is stable. Do not disconnect during the "Save" process.
This fixes sticks that move on their own: This fixes sticks that move on their own.
Follow the prompt: Rotate both sticks 3: Follow the prompt: Rotate both sticks 3 times fully, then let go.
The tool will calculate the offset and a: The tool will calculate the offset and apply it.
This fixes sticks that don't reach full: This fixes sticks that don't reach full speed (e.g., character runs slowly).
Rotate the sticks to their absolute maxi: Rotate the sticks to their absolute maximum limits in all directions.
The tool expands the internal mapping to: The tool expands the internal mapping to ensure 100% output at the edges.

Google's use of advertising cookies enab: Google's use of advertising cookies enables it and its partners to serve ads to you based on your visit to AB Control Hub and/or other sites on the Internet.
You may opt out of personalized advertis: You may opt out of personalized advertising by visiting Google Ads Settings.
Currently, we use <strong>Google Analyti: Currently, we use Google Analytics to analyze traffic. This service transmits website traffic data to Google servers. We use this data strictly to monitor service stability and user demographics to improve the tool.
Diagnose, Test, and Calibrate your <stro: Diagnose, Test, and Calibrate your DualSense & DualShock 4 controllers directly from your browser. Fix Stick Drift permanently, check input latency, and verify button functionality without installing any drivers or third-party software.
Unlike software deadzones, AB Control Hu: Unlike software deadzones, AB Control Hub writes calibration data directly to your controller's NVS memory. This fixes stick drift permanently across all devices, including consoles and PC.
Powered by the WebHID API, all processin: Powered by the WebHID API, all processing happens locally in your browser. No inputs are recorded, no data is uploaded, and no risky driver installations are required.
Use our advanced \"Circularity Test\" to: Use our advanced "Circularity Test" to visualize potentiometer linearity. Detect counterfeit "High Copy" controllers that suffer from square input ranges and poor polling rates.
<i class=\"fas fa-book me-2 text-info\">: Understanding Analog Stick Drift
Modern controllers like the DualSense an: Modern controllers like the DualSense and DualShock 4 use ALPS analog stick modules. These rely on potentiometers—variable resistors with physical wipers that slide across carbon tracks. Over time, friction causes two main issues:
<strong>Wear of the Carbon Track:</stron: Wear of the Carbon Track: Changes the electrical resistance, confusing the center point.
<strong>Dust Accumulation:</strong> Cond: Dust Accumulation: Conductive debris causes "jitter" and erratic signals.
When this happens, your controller repor: When this happens, your controller reports movement even when the stick is idle. AB Control Hub calculates the error offset and updates the controller's internal calibration map to compensate for this physical wear.

<i class=\"fas fa-info-circle me-2 text-: How AB Control Hub Works
AB Control Hub utilizes the advanced <st: AB Control Hub utilizes the advanced WebHID API (Human Interface Device) available in modern browsers like Google Chrome and Microsoft Edge. This technology allows the website to communicate directly with your game controller's firmware without requiring you to download or install any external drivers or executable files.
When you connect your DualSense or DualS: When you connect your DualSense or DualShock 4, the tool reads the raw data reports sent by the controller via USB. This includes analog stick coordinates, button states, battery levels, and sensor data. By bypassing the operating system's standard input processing, we can offer features that are typically restricted to official development kits, such as writing calibration data directly to the controller's permanent memory.
<i class=\"fas fa-cogs me-2 text-warning: Hardware Calibration vs. Software Deadzones
Most drift \"fixes\" found online or in: Most drift "fixes" found online or in game settings rely on increasing the Deadzone. This software-based approach simply ignores the input from the center of the stick. While it hides the drift, it reduces the responsive range of your analog stick, making precise aiming in FPS games or subtle steering in racing simulators impossible. It is a temporary band-aid, not a cure.
AB Control Hub performs <strong>Hardware: AB Control Hub performs Hardware-Level Calibration. By accessing the controller's Non-Volatile Storage (NVS), we calculate the exact error offset caused by potentiometer wear. We then update the controller's internal zero-point. This means the correction happens inside the controller itself. When you plug your controller into a PS5, PS4, or PC, it reports a perfectly centered signal with zero deadzone required.
The Circularity Test measures how accura: The Circularity Test measures how accurately your analog stick traces a perfect circle. Official Sony controllers typically have an average error rate of 8-12%. Counterfeit or "High Copy" controllers often fail this test, showing square-shaped boundaries or high error rates (above 20%). This tool helps you verify the authenticity of your gamepad.
Deep dives into gamepad architecture, We: Deep dives into gamepad architecture, WebHID protocols, and firmware calibration techniques.

The Physics of Stick Drift: Why It Happe: The Physics of Stick Drift: Why It Happens & The Real Fix
Stick drift is the plague of modern gami: Stick drift is the plague of modern gaming. You're in a heated match, and suddenly your camera pans left without you touching the controller. But what is actually happening inside the hardware?
Most modern controllers, including the D: Most modern controllers, including the DualSense and DualShock 4, use ALPS analog stick modules. These rely on potentiometers—variable resistors that use a physical wiper sliding across a carbon track to measure position. It is a friction-based system.
Over time, two things inevitably happen:: Over time, two things inevitably happen:
<strong>Carbon Wear:</strong> The wiper: Carbon Wear: The wiper physically scrapes off the resistive carbon layer, changing the electrical resistance values. The controller expects "0 Volts" at the center, but now receives "0.2 Volts", interpreting it as movement.
<strong>Debris Buildup:</strong> The scr: Debris Buildup: The scraped-off carbon dust is conductive. It accumulates inside the sensor housing, creating erratic electrical jumps (jitter).
Increasing the deadzone in your game set: Increasing the deadzone in your game settings acts as a band-aid. It tells the game to ignore the first 10-15% of stick movement. While this hides the drift, it destroys your precision. You lose the ability to make subtle movements, which is fatal in competitive FPS or racing games.
AB Control Hub takes a different approac: AB Control Hub takes a different approach. Instead of ignoring the input, we access the controller's Non-Volatile Storage (NVS). By measuring the exact error offset of your worn stick, we can write a new "center point" directly to the controller's firmware. The controller then does the math internally, sending a perfect (0,0) signal to the console. This restores full dynamic range without sacrificing precision.
Traditionally, calibrating a controller: Traditionally, calibrating a controller required downloading shady .exe files or installing unsigned drivers. The WebHID API changes everything.
WebHID allows Google Chrome (and Edge) t: WebHID allows Google Chrome (and Edge) to communicate directly with Human Interface Devices over USB or Bluetooth. It is strictly permission-based—the website cannot see your device until you explicitly click "Connect" in the browser popup.
For AB Control Hub, this allows us to se: For AB Control Hub, this allows us to send Feature Reports (Byte arrays) to the DualSense to trigger calibration modes that were previously only accessible to factory technicians. All of this runs locally in your browser memory; no data ever leaves your computer.
Spotting a Fake: The Circularity Test: Spotting a Fake: The Circularity Test
The market is flooded with \"High Copy\": The market is flooded with "High Copy" DualShock 4 controllers. They look identical to the original, but the internals are vastly inferior.
Original Sony controllers have high-fide: Original Sony controllers have high-fidelity analog to digital converters (ADCs). When you rotate the stick, it draws a near-perfect circle. Fake controllers often use cheap components that result in a "Square" input boundary. They physically cannot reach the diagonal corners effectively, or they snap to the axes too aggressively.
Use the <strong>\"Circularity Test\"</st: Use the "Circularity Test" on our homepage. A genuine controller typically has an average error rate of 8-12%. If you see error rates above 20% or a square shape in the visualizer, you likely have a counterfeit device.
The DualSense is a power-hungry beast, t: The DualSense is a power-hungry beast, thanks to its haptic motors and adaptive triggers. Here are the most effective ways to squeeze extra hours out of your charge:
<strong>Dim the Light Bar:</strong> Set: Dim the Light Bar: Set the brightness to "Dim" in your PS5 settings. This simple change reduces heat and power draw.
<strong>Microphone Mute:</strong> The bu: Microphone Mute: The built-in mic is always listening by default. Muting it (orange light on) actually saves battery because the audio processing chip goes into a lower power state.
<strong>Haptic Intensity:</strong> Unles: Haptic Intensity: Unless you are playing a single-player immersion game, set vibration to "Weak" or "Off" for competitive multiplayer. The motors draw significant current.
<strong>Proper Charging:</strong> Avoid: Proper Charging: Avoid using "Fast Chargers" meant for phones directly into the controller's USB-C port. The high voltage negotiation can sometimes damage the power management IC (PMIC). Stick to the console's USB ports or a certified dock.

\"No Device Selected\" or Device not sho: "No Device Selected" or Device not showing up
<ul>\n:
• Make sure you are not using a "Charge Only" USB cable. Try a different cable.
  • Close DS4Windows, Steam, Epic Games Launcher, and GeForce Experience. These apps "hide" the controller from the browser (Exclusive Mode).
  • On Linux, you might need to add `udev` rules to allow Chrome to access HID devices.
<p>If software calibration fails, the ha:
If software calibration fails, the hardware damage might be too severe. Consider:

  • Cleaning the analog stick module with compressed air (isopropyl alcohol).
  • Replacing the potentiometer sensor (requires soldering).
  • If the drift is "jumping" erratically, it's likely dirt/dust, not just calibration wear.
This usually happens on Windows when ano: This usually happens on Windows when another program has "Exclusive Access" to the device. Ensure no other controller mappers are running. Unplug and replug the controller.

Every time you move the stick, friction: Every time you move the stick, friction occurs. Over hundreds of hours of gameplay, this friction causes wear of the carbon track and conductive dust accumulation.
When this happens, the controller report: When this happens, the controller reports movement (e.g., Value +15) even when centered (Value 0). This is Stick Drift.
Since we cannot physically repair the ca: Since we cannot physically repair the carbon track via software, our tool uses Firmware Level Calibration. We calculate the exact error offset of your drifted stick and write a new "Center Point" to the controller's permanent memory (NVS). This forces the controller to mathematically ignore the drift at a hardware level.
<strong>AB Control Hub</strong> is built: AB Control Hub is built on the WebHID API (Web Human Interface Device). This eliminates the need for sketchy .exe downloads or drivers.
The browser communicates directly with t: The browser communicates directly with the USB/Bluetooth HID Report Descriptors for millisecond precision.
Unlike native apps, a website cannot rea: Unlike native apps, a website cannot read your files or access other hardware without explicit permission.
Runs identically on Windows, macOS, Linu: Runs identically on Windows, macOS, Linux, and Android.
Use our advanced diagnostic tools to spo: Use our advanced diagnostic tools to spot "High Copy" controllers.
Switch the visualizer to <strong>\"Circu: Switch the visualizer to "Circularity Mode" and rotate your stick in a perfect circle.
<strong>Fake:</strong> Error &gt; 20%. S: Fake: Error > 20%. Shape looks like a square/diamond.
Do NOT disconnect the cable while saving: Do NOT disconnect the cable while saving. This writes to the controller's internal memory.
Fixes drift (stick moving on its own): Fixes drift (stick moving on its own)
The tool calculates and saves the offset: The tool calculates and saves the offset.

<i class=\"fas fa-exclamation-triangle m: Calibration Didn't Fix The Drift
<p>If software calibration fails, the ph:
If software calibration fails, the physical damage to the potentiometer is likely too severe.

  • Try cleaning the module with compressed air or Isopropyl Alcohol.
  • If the value "jumps" erratically (e.g., center -> 100% -> center), it is a dirty sensor, not just wear.
  • Last resort: Solder a new potentiometer sensor.

Why Potentiometers fail and why \"Deadzo: Why Potentiometers fail and why "Deadzone" is not a fix.
It starts as a subtle twitch in your cam: It starts as a subtle twitch in your camera angle. Then, your character starts walking to the left on their own. Stick drift is the nightmare of every gamer. But to fix it permanently, we must first understand the physics occurring inside the plastic shell.
Most modern controllers, including the D: Most modern controllers, including the DualSense and DualShock 4, use joystick modules manufactured by ALPS Alpine. These are not digital switches; they are analog components based on a technology called the Potentiometer.
Fig 1. The internal carbon track (Resist: Fig 1. The internal carbon track (Resistive Element) and the metal Wiper.
The mechanism relies on two key parts:: The mechanism relies on two key parts:
A semicircular strip made of Carbon, whi: A semicircular strip made of Carbon, which acts as a resistor.
A small metal arm that slides physically: A small metal arm that slides physically across the carbon track when you move the stick.
Electrically, the joystick acts as a vol:
Electrically, the joystick acts as a voltage divider. The console reads the voltage output ($V_{out}$) which changes based on the wiper's position on the resistive track.

$$V_{out} = V_{in} \times \frac{R_2}{R_1 + R_2}$$
When the wiper is perfectly centered, the resistance should be balanced. Drift happens when this balance is lost.
Friction is the enemy. Every time you mo: Friction is the enemy. Every time you move the stick, the metal wiper scrapes against the carbon track. Over hundreds of hours of gameplay, two things happen:
The carbon layer physically thins out, c: The carbon layer physically thins out, changing its electrical resistance.
Microscopic carbon dust accumulates, cre: Microscopic carbon dust accumulates, creating "phantom" conductive paths.
This causes the sensor to report a volta: This causes the sensor to report a voltage value (e.g., 2.6V) even when the stick is physically centered (which should be 2.5V). The console interprets this extra voltage as "Movement".
Most games and tutorials suggest increas: Most games and tutorials suggest increasing the Deadzone. This is a software filter that tells the game: "Ignore any input below 10%."
Fig 2. Deadzone (Red) kills responsivene: Fig 2. Deadzone (Red) kills responsiveness. Calibration (Green) restores linearity.
While this stops the camera from moving: While this stops the camera from moving on its own, it comes at a heavy cost:
You lose the ability to make fine, subtl: You lose the ability to make fine, subtle movements.
You have to push the stick further befor: You have to push the stick further before the character reacts.
This is where <a href=\"../index.html\": This is where AB Control Hub differs. Instead of ignoring the error, we fix it at the source.
Modern controllers have an internal memo: Modern controllers have an internal memory chip called NVS (Non-Volatile Storage). This chip stores the "Zero Point" calibration data. Our tool calculates the exact error offset caused by the wear in your specific controller and writes a new "Center" value directly to the NVS.
The result? A controller that is perfect: The result? A controller that is perfectly centered at the hardware level, with Zero Deadzone required.
Don't throw away your DualSense. Calibra: Don't throw away your DualSense. Calibrate it now directly in your browser.

WebHID API Explained: Driverless USB for: WebHID API Explained: Driverless USB for the Web | AB Control Hub
For decades, accessing hardware like gam: For decades, accessing hardware like game controllers required installing heavy drivers or third-party software (like DS4Windows). The WebHID API changed everything. It allows a website to communicate directly with Human Interface Devices (HID) securely.
WebHID (Human Interface Device) is a mod: WebHID (Human Interface Device) is a modern browser API that gives JavaScript access to USB devices that were previously inaccessible. This is the technology powering AB Control Hub, allowing us to read your analog stick data and write calibration fixes directly to the controller's firmware.
Fig 1. The browser acts as a bridge betw: Fig 1. The browser acts as a bridge between the USB Hardware and the Web Page.
Connecting to a device is surprisingly s: Connecting to a device is surprisingly simple. Here is the actual logic used in our tool to find a Sony DualSense controller:
Once connected, we receive \"Input Repor: Once connected, we receive "Input Reports" (Hexadecimal data) 250 times per second. We parse these bytes to draw the visualizer you see on the screen.
Security is the #1 priority. The WebHID: Security is the #1 priority. The WebHID API operates in a strict Sandbox:
The code above <em>cannot</em> run autom: The code above cannot run automatically. It must be triggered by a click (like the "Connect" button).
The browser opens a system prompt asking: The browser opens a system prompt asking you to select a specific device. The website cannot see any other USB devices connected to your PC.
The site can only talk to the specific d: The site can only talk to the specific device you chose, it cannot access your files or webcam.
By using WebHID, AB Control Hub offers:: By using WebHID, AB Control Hub offers:
No middleware. Raw data comes straight f: No middleware. Raw data comes straight from USB to Chrome.
Works on Windows, Mac, Linux, and Androi: Works on Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android instantly.
See the raw input data from your control: See the raw input data from your controller in real-time.

Detecting Fake PS4/PS5 Controllers: The: Detecting Fake PS4/PS5 Controllers: The Circularity Test | AB Control Hub
The market is flooded with \"High Copy\": The market is flooded with "High Copy" controllers. They look exactly like the original Sony DualSense/DualShock 4, have the same weight, and even the same logos. But inside, they use cheap components. Here is how to expose them using the AB Control Hub test.
An original analog stick is designed to: An original analog stick is designed to move in a perfect circle. However, cheap potentiometers often struggle to reach the corners or overshoot them, creating a "Square" input shape.
<strong>Circularity</strong> calculates: Circularity calculates the average error deviation from a perfect circle. We measure thousands of points as you rotate the stick.
Fig 1. Left: Original Sony (Round). Righ: Fig 1. Left: Original Sony (Round). Right: Fake Copy (Square).
You don't need to be an expert. Just loo: You don't need to be an expert. Just look at the "Avg Error" number in our tool:
You might think: <em>\"It's cheap, so wh: You might think: "It's cheap, so what?". Using a fake controller affects your gameplay severely:
<strong>Deadzone Issues:</strong> <span: Deadzone Issues: Fakes have massive built-in deadzones to hide their poor quality. You can't aim precisely.
<strong>No Calibration:</strong> <span c: No Calibration: Our NVS calibration tools usually CANNOT fix fake controllers because they use non-standard memory chips.
Go to the \"Joystick Info\" section on t: Go to the "Joystick Info" section on the dashboard.
Is your controller Real or Fake?: Is your controller Real or Fake?
Run the test now and find out the truth.

Where does the 1560mAh go? A technical b: Where does the 1560mAh go? A technical breakdown.
The PlayStation 5 controller is a techno: The PlayStation 5 controller is a technological marvel, but its battery life is often criticized. With a capacity of 1560mAh (compared to the DS4's 1000mAh), why does it drain so fast? We hooked it up to a multimeter to find out.
Unlike older controllers, the DualSense: Unlike older controllers, the DualSense powers multiple heavy-duty motors and sensors simultaneously. Here is the breakdown of current draw (in milliamperes):
Did you know? Leaving the DualSense micr: Did you know? Leaving the DualSense microphone ON (Light off) keeps the audio processing chip in high-power mode. It also reduces the vibration intensity automatically.
<strong>Pro Tip:</strong> Always mute th: Pro Tip: Always mute the mic (Orange light ON) when not in use. This saves about 10-15% of battery life per session.
Fig 1. Internal view of the 1560mAh Li-i: Fig 1. Internal view of the 1560mAh Li-ion battery pack.
Lithium-ion batteries degrade over time: Lithium-ion batteries degrade over time based on "Cycles". One cycle is a full 100% to 0% drain. To extend the lifespan of your controller:
<strong>Avoid Deep Discharge:</strong> <: Avoid Deep Discharge: Don't let it hit 0%. Charge it when it reaches 20%.
<strong>Heat is the Enemy:</strong> <spa: Heat is the Enemy: Never charge while playing if the controller feels hot. Heat degrades internal chemistry.
For maximum playtime without sacrificing: For maximum playtime without sacrificing the "Next-Gen" feel, we recommend:
